preclusion: LL4453V / LL5453V / LL6453V / LLJ5453V Fashion Law
description: This module provides an overview of how intellectual property laws (e.g. copyright, trademarks and right of publicity) regulate the world of fashion. It will also explore the enforcement of intellectual property laws in the fashion industry from an interdisciplinary perspective drawing on writings in cultural studies and fashion theory.
title: Fashion Law
prerequisite:
NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent.

This is an advanced module. Students should have 
completed either: 
(1) Law of Intellectual Property
LL4405A / LL5405A / LL6405A / LLJ5405A / LC5405A; 
LL4405B / LL5405B / LL6405B / LLJ5405B / LC5405B; or
(2) LL4070V/LL5070V/LL6070V/LLJ5070; 
LL4070/LL5070/LL6070/LLJ5070 Foundations of IP.
